AllCards.Title: Bilbo Baggins

Text: The first player gains control of Bilbo Baggins.
Bilbo Baggins cannot gain resources from player card effects.
If Bilbo Baggins leaves play, the players lose the game.

AllCards.CardSet: The Hobbit: Over Hill and Under Hill

Text: Bilbo Baggins does not count against the hero limit and cannot gain resources from non-treasure cards.
The first player gains control of Bilbo Baggins.
Action: Spend 1 Baggins resource to search your deck for a treasure card and add it to your hand.
If Bilbo Baggins leaves play, the players have lost the game.

AllCards.Title: Glamdring

Text: Attach to a hero or Gandalf.
Attached character gets +2 Attack.
Response: After attached character destroys an Orc enemy, draw 1 card.

AllCards.CardSet: The Hobbit: Over Hill and Under Hill

AllCards.Title: Sting

Text: Attach to Bilbo Baggins.
Bilbo Baggins gets +1 Willpower, +1 Attack, and +1 Defense.
Response: After Bilbo Baggins exhausts to defend, discard the top card of the encounter deck. Deal damage to the attacking enemy equal to the discarded card`s Threat.
Front.FlavorText: `I shall call you Sting.` -Bilbo, The Hobbit

AllCards.CardSet: The Hobbit: Over Hill and Under Hill

AllCards.Title: Orcrist

Text: Attach to a hero.
Attached character gets +2 Attack.Response: After attached hero destroys an Orc enemy, add 1 resource to that hero`s resource pool.
Front.FlavorText: `This, Thorin, the runes name Orcrist, the Goblin-cleaver in the ancient tongue of Gondolin; it was a famous blade.` -Elrond, The Hobbit

AllCards.CardSet: The Hobbit: Over Hill and Under Hill

Text: Attach to Bilbo Baggins.
Action: Exhaust Bilbo`s Magic Ring and raise your threat by 1 to gain 1 Baggins resource. (Limit once per round.)
Response: After Bilbo Baggins exhausts to defend an attack, exhaust Bilbo`s Magic Ring and raise your threat by 3 to cancel all damage from this attack.
Attach to Bilbo Baggins.
Attached hero gets +1 Defense and +1 hit point.
Front.FlavorText:
`Mr. Baggins!` he cried. `Here is the first payment of your reward! Cast off your old coat and put on this!`
-Thorin, The Hobbit

Text: Attach to a hero.
Action: Add Thror`s Golden Cup to the victory display to draw 3 cards.
Front.FlavorText:
...the great golden cup of Thror, two-handed, hammered and carven with birds and flowers whose eyes and petals were of jewels...
-The Hobbit

Text: Attach to a hero. Restricted.
Attached hero gains Ranged.
When making a ranged attack, attached hero gets +2 Attack.
Front.FlavorText:
Thorin seized a bow of horn and shot an arrow at the speaker.
-The Hobbit

Text: Attach to a hero.
Action: Exhaust The Arkenstone and raise your threat by X to lower by X the cost of the next ally you play this phase that matches the attached hero`s sphere.
Front.FlavorText:
`...the Heart of the Mountain; and it is also the heart of Thorin. He values it above a rive of gold.`
-Bilbo, The Hobbit

Text: Attach to a hero. Restricted.
Attached hero gets +2 Attack.
Response: After attached hero attacks and destroys an enemy, deal 1 damage to another enemy engaged with you.
Front.FlavorText:
Royal indeed did Thorin look, clad in a coat of gold-plated rings, with a silver hafted axe...
-The Hobbit

Text: Setup: Each player may shuffle 1 copy Bilbo`s Magic Ring into his deck. Search the encounter deck for The Spider`s Glade and set it aside, out of play. Then, shuffle the encounter deck and reveal 1 encounter card per player.
Front.FlavorText:
`Stick to the forest-track, keep your spirits up, hope for the best, and with a tremendous slice of luck you may come out one day and see the Long Marshes lying below you, and beyond them, high in the East, the Lonely Mountain where dear old Smaug lives.`
-Gandalf, The Hobbit

Text: Unconscious characters cannot quest, attack, defend, collect resources, trigger abilities, be poisoned, or ready (except by effects that target unconscious character).

Front.FlavorText: The nights were the worst. It then became pitch-dark - not what you call pitch-dark, but really pitch, so black that you really could see nothing. Bilbo tried flapping his hand in front of his nose but he could not see it at all. Well, perhaps it is not true to say they could see nothing: they could see eyes. -The Hobbit

Text: When Revealed: Reveal stage 3 and create a separate staging area for the first player use that stage. If there are not other players in the game, discard this stage and each card in the staging area. All other players advance to stage 4.
Back.FlavorText: ... the cries of the others got steadily further and fainter, and though after a while it seemed to him they changed to yells and cries for help in the far distance, all noise at last died right away, and he was left alone in complete silence and darkness. -The Hobbit

Text: When Revealed: Remove all resources from each hero`s resource pool. Then, make each character you control (except Bilbo Baggins) unconscious.
Front.FlavorText: Bilbo was horrified, now that he noticed them for the first time dangling in the shadows, to see a dwarvish foot sticking out from the bottoms of some of the bundles, or here and there the tip of a nose, or a bit of beard or of a hood. -The Hobbit

Text:
Unconscious characters cannot quest, attack, defend, collect resources, trigger abilities, be poisoned, or ready (except by effects that target unconscious character).

Do not pass the first player token. When this stage is complete, do not advance to stage 4 until the end of the quest phase. (Combine staging areas if necessary.)

Action: Spend 2 Baggins resources to ready and unconscious character you control.
When Revealed: Add The Spider`s Glade to the staging area.
Front.FlavorText: Then the battle began. Some of the dwarves had knives, and some had sticks, and all of them could get stones; and Bilbo had his elvish dagger. Again and again the spiders were beaten off, and many of them were killed. But it could not go on for long. -The Hobbit

Text:
Unconscious characters cannot quest, attack, defend, collect resources, trigger abilities, be poisoned, or ready (except by effects that target unconscious character).

Progress cannot be placed on this stage while The Spider`s Glade is in play.

Action: Spend 2 Baggins resources to ready an unconscious character you control.

If the players defeat this stage, they have won the game and discovered the treasure card Bilbo`s Magic Ring.
When Revealed: Choose a hero to be removed from the quest and make that hero unconscious. If no hero was removed from the quest by this effect, this card gains surge.
Front.FlavorText: `What nasty thick skins they have to be sure, but I`ll wager there is good juice inside.` -Spider, The Hobbit

Text: When Revealed: This enemy attacks the character with the most poison attached.

Forced: After Dark Bats damages a character, attach it to that character. (While attached, counts as a Condition attachment with the text: `Attached character gets -1 Willpower, -1 Attack, and -1 Defense.`)
Front.Shadow: Shadow: Attach this card to the defending character.

Text: This enemy gets +3 Attack while engaged with a player who controls at least 1 poisoned character.
Front.Shadow: Shadow: Defending character gets 1 poison. (Give 2 poison to a character you control if undefended.)

Text: When Revealed: The first player names a sphere. Then, all non-Baggins characters who do not belong to the named sphere are removed from the quest.
Front.Shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Attack. (+2 Attack instead if undefended.)

Text: While Forest Stream is the active location, poisoned characters cannot quest.Response: After Forest Stream leaves play as an explored location, discard 4 poison.
Front.FlavorText: It flowed fast and strong but not very wide right across the way, and it was black, or looked it in the gloom. -The Hobbit

Text: While Giant Web is the active location, each character gets -1 Willpower, -1 Attack, and -1 Defense for each poison it has.Response: After Giant Web leaves play as an explored location, ready an unconscious character.
While Hidden Path is the active location, locations in the staging area get -1 Threat.Travel: Spend 2 Baggins resources to travel here.
Front.FlavorText: About midday, creeping behind a great stone that stood alone like a pillar, Bilbo came on what looked like rough steps going upwards. -The Hobbit

Text: When Revealed: Each character committed to the quest gets 1 poison.
Front.Shadow: Shadow: If defending character is poisoned, make that character unconscious.

Text: Forced: At the end of each round, each player must give a hero he controls 1 poison.
Front.FlavorText: ...hairy legs waving, nippers an dspinners snapping, eyes popping, full of froth and rage. -The Hobbit

Text: When Revealed: Each character takes damage equal to the number of poison it has. If no characters were damaged by this effect, this card gains surge.
Front.Shadow: Shadow: Discard an unconscious character you control.

Text: Immune to player card effects.

Travel: Exhaust Bilbo Baggins to travel here.Forced: At the start of each quest phase, search the encounter deck for 1 Spider enemy and add it to the staging area. (2 Spider enemies instead if 3 or more players are at this stage.) Shuffle the encounter deck.
Venom.
Forced: When this enemy attacks, defending player must attach 1 poison to a character he controls.
When Revealed: Until the end of the round, exhausted characters get -1 Willpower, -1 Attack, and -1 Defense.
Front.Shadow: Shadow: If the defending character is destroyed by this attack, its controller must raise his threat by 5.
